Moreover, the first abbot of the same monastery was one Peter, a priest‚ which being sent legate unto Gaul was drowned in a creek of the sea called Amfleatf· and buried after a homely manner of the inhabitants of the same place. But Almighty God intending to have it known how worthy a man he was, made that every night there appeared a light from heaven upon the place where he lay buried, until the neigh- bours about, which saw the light, gathering thereby that he was some holy man that was buried there, and searching out what and from whence he was, removed his body from thence, and buried it in the church⁴¹ in the town of Bouloffne according to the honour convenient for so worthy a person.
